intro: Sanicula europaea subsp. elata, commonly known as the tall European sanicle, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shady habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. It features slender, upright stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in umbrella-like inflorescences, typical of the carrot family.
